content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed using direction RIGHT (drop position at Position(x=4.5, y=17.5))
– Additional burner inserters forming part of the connected network:
 • Burner inserter at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5) (with coal fuel and linked via a nearby transport belt at Position(x=0.5, y=17.5))
 • Burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (with pickup at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) and drop at Position(x=2.5, y=15.5))
– Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) that receives items via these inserters

Use case: This structure is designed to feed and process materials for copper-cable production.

### Depot Belt System at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) installed adjacent to the depot chest
– Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) placed using direction UP, serving as the interface for item retrieval

Use case: This system is intended to channel outputs from the extraction system into a stable depot for downstream processing.

### Electricity Generator at position (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

Use case: This structure provides electrical power for connected facilities.

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Issues
 – Transport belts must not be attached directly to a steam engine (Prototype.SteamEngine). Always add and use an inserter that can feed items into the power-producing unit to serve as the connection target.

• Entity Placement Distance
 – When receiving errors about target positions being too far (e.g. wooden chest placement at Position(3.5,15.5)), ensure that the player is moved within the maximum allowable placement distance before attempting to place the entity.

• Inventory Availability
 – Before attempting to place an entity (such as a wooden chest), verify that the required item is present in the inventory to avoid placement failures.

• Variable Naming Consistency
 – Errors such as “name ‘target_chest’ is not defined” indicate inconsistent variable naming. Double-check that all referenced variable names match the defined ones to prevent NameErrors.
